page.title: 06INDUSTRY
page.content: Wright's Willow Works is one of only two cricket bat producers in the country.First willow trunks are sawn into sections for bats.They get 20-30 from 1 tree.First the face is cut,then the sides and apex,they are then stored in the open for a month and then dipped into wax.Afer that the bats go into the kiln for 8 weeks,at which point they are sold to retailers. They sell quality bats for Â£80 each.They make 5000 bats a week .The wood they don't want is burnt and some used to make paper.Wickets are made out of ash as it is light and easily seen. Bats and wickets are sent to India,Australia,and South Africa. Other products include rolling pins,meat hammers,ladder rungs,skittles,base balls,polo balls,artificial limbs.
